description: Define the sequence T(a(0),a(1)) by a(n+2) is the greatest integer such that a(n+2)/a(n+1) < a(n+1)/a(n) for n >= 0. This is T(4,17).
comments: The empirical g.f. / recurrence agrees with the original definition for at least 2000 terms (and a(2000) ~ 10^1250). - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 11 2016
links: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
author: _R. K. Guy_
